title: It is written by a good pedagogue and is well illustrated. A systematic and complete course. The level is a little lower compared to the present manual
Theoretical Mechanics of Particles and Continua
This is a fundamental book at a high and rigorous level with very wide and detailed exposition. It is very worthwhile book for the modern state of theoretical mechanics
Classical Mechanics
This book is a masterpiece with many examples which are selected very carefully. Even though it is a book for physicists, I recommend it to the reader of this course
Classical mechanics
Very appropriate combination between physics and mathematics. Many mathematical categories (e.g. vectors, differential equations etc.) are used from the start in the text itself
A nice complement to the theoretical-mechanics courses in the list. This is an excellent manual
Pergamon Press

This is the basic book for the course. The exposition is compact (in some places synoptically), consecutive and rigorous. This is the most accessible book of the series of superb books covering all of theoretical physics
Fundamental of Theoretical Physics
Part I is comparable with the level of theoretical mechanics of this course with detailed mathematical explanations
The material necessary for this course is exposed completely and accessibly on a very good pedagogical level
A Treatise on the Analytical Dynamics of Particles and Rigid Bodies

This is a well-known book giving the a complete exposition of theoretical mechanics with an old point of view. I included the book in this list only because many special problems are explained very well in it, which could be hardly found in other sources
Elementary modern physics
This is a good manual with a good physical interpretation, which is accessible and comprehensible. The level is lower than this book, for first reading
Molecular Quantum Mechanics

container-title: Elementary Quantum Theory, II. Formal Aspects of the Quantum Theory, III. Atom and Molecular Spectra, IV. Electrical and Magnetic Properties of Molecules
title: This is an irreplaceable book for a chemist. It consists of four parts: I
Perspectives of Modern Physics

This is an accessible book, nice manual at a lower level, comparable to the present book. The book is extremely useful for chemistry students with the consideration of chemical objects and a successful combination of popular explanations with high scientific level

I include in the references this book, because much of the material in it is not to be found in any other textbook. There are detailed discussions of calculation methods in the photoelectric effect, atomic structure, atomic collisions and the multiplet splitting
Principles of Quantum Mechanics

note: It is a university manual (difficult one).
title: It is a basic book for this course and its level is comparable to this one
Atomic Physics
The book is useful for a number of here discussed questions, it is a nice manual
Introduction to Quantum Mechanics
This is a detailed and wide version of quantum mechanics. The book is clear and easily readable with a lot of examples. It is ta book for first reading and there are more topics than in this course
Quantum Mechanics
This is an advanced book. It emphasizes the treatment of many physical systems which are not considered in this course
Introduction to Quantum Mechanics
This well-known manual of Princeton University for physicists is on a level with the present book (maybe a little higher). The explanations are compact and physical and the problems are nice
Quantum Physics of Atoms, Molecules, Solids, Nuclei, and Particles

note: The difficult mathematical problems are taken out of the text into appendices.
title: The main merit of the book is the excellent physical explanation of the problems. The book interprets very many topics, which are not in this course. The explanations are very detailed ones and the volume is large
Physics of Atoms and Molecules, an Introduction to the Structure of Matter

As a manner of education it is not a standard course of quantum mechanics. Traditionally classical mechanics is studied in the first year and the theoretical mechanics is left for the subsequent yeas. The authors propose two levels of quantum-mechanical education. This book is the first level. The book is some kind of a transition from atomic physics to the standard formal apparatus of quantum mechanics
This part of the famous Feynman lectures is for the first reading. It is not enough for the level of this course
Physics for Computer Science Students with Emphasis on Atomic and Semiconductor Physics

This is not really a textbook on quantum mechanics, but Chapters 18-24 are devoted to the basic of quantum mechanics. Subsequently and successfully, the problems of the microword are exposed with more physics than mathematics, for the first reading
Quantum Physics
This university course for physicists is a good manual which covers more topics that the present book. The book should be understandable to the student who has gone through the material of this book
Quantum Mechanics
This is a fundamental book. It is widely used and is one of the best modern manuals for physicists and the level is higher than here
Quantum Mechanics, Non-Relativistic Theory

The book is one of the well-known series (see [R5]) for theoretical physics. It is a fundamental and advanced book, which discusses a number of advanced topics in some details. A student who has reached the advanced level will find much that is useful in this book

Quantum Physics). There is only a few books, which introduce quantum-mechanical formalism intuitively and in this way give to the reader a sense of how quantum mechanics manifests itself in Nature. A number of fascinating examples are discussed with a minimum of formal apparatus. The book is not for first reading
Introductory Quantum Mechanics

note: since it is always useful to see the same basic material presented from a different point of view.
title: This is a very good manual, with illustrative figures and comprehensible discussion on high physical level about both the fundamental of quantum mechanics and its applications in simple systems (mainly one-dimensional). There is a review of the concepts of classical mechanics which relate directly to quantum mechanics The students, who have reached the advanced level are encouraged to look it up
Quantum Mechanics
The level is comparable with the present book. There are many problems and this is a book for first reading
Quantum Mechanics

This is a fundamental book at a high level with large volume and detailed and thorough exposition. It covers quantum theory completely, including the elements of relativistic quantum mechanics. This is an advanced book and it requires a mathematical sophistication
Quantum Mechanics

The foundations of quantum mechanics are exposed compactly and subsequently at a good pedagogical level. The book is useful for students because it is written relying only on physical and mathematical concepts usually taught in the first year of an undergraduate course
Principles of Quantum Mechanics

This is an advanced book that develops the subject from its postulates. The level is high, but the language is clear and comprehensible. It is written for physicists and is for starting graduate students
Quantum Mechanics
This was one of the most popular books in the past with at a very high pedagogical level of physics. The book is compact and the calculations are left to the reader
Atomic Structure and Spectral lines, E
Most popular monograph in the past. The best and complete exposition of the old quantum mechanics. The physical interpretation and the clearness of the explanations are simple also today
It is the a basic book for this course. Despite that it is relatively old, it is a nice manual with a lot of pedagogical finds
Quantum Physics
The book is for references about the physical essence of the problems
The Basics of Quantum Physics: Understanding the Photoelectric Effect and Line Spectra
I recommend this book students to read before this course. It gives a good starting knowledge of quantum mechanics
Angular Momentum (Understanding Spatial Aspects in Chemistry and Physics
It is not a book on quantum mechanics, but a good superstructure in treatment of angular momentum in many applications in atomic physics. The book is very useful for chemists
